avalancheActivity.comment:
More recent wind slabs are mostly easy to recognise but in some cases prone to triggering. The fresh and older wind slabs can be released by a single winter sport participant in some cases, in particular on shady slopes above approximately 2200 m. Mostly avalanches are rather small. In very isolated cases avalanches can release deeper layers of the snowpack and reach medium size.
The avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain, caution is to be exercised in particular at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack, when entering gullies and bowls for example.

snowpackStructure.comment:
As a consequence of a sometimes strong wind, rather small wind slabs formed in particular in gullies and bowls and behind abrupt changes in the terrain. The wind slabs are lying on weak layers in particular on steep shady slopes.
Faceted weak layers exist in the old snowpack especially on shady slopes.
Snow depths vary greatly, depending on the infuence of the wind.

avalancheActivity.comment: Yesterday the wind was strong adjacent to ridgelines over a wide area. The sometimes strong wind has transported some snow. The fresh wind slabs are to be found in particular adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls. The avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls in all aspects above approximately 2000 m and at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack. The small wind slabs can be released, especially by large additional loads,. This applies in particular at their margins.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The wind slabs represent the main danger.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Faceted weak layers exist in the old snowpack especially on shady slopes.
Snow depths vary greatly, depending on the infuence of the wind. Only a little snow is lying.
